    demo

    demo.Rmd
    #remotes::install_github("PengSU517/robcovsel")
#remotes::install_github("PengSU517/shootings") !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
#This shootings package is not my original work. The functions in this package were forked from https://github.com/ineswilms/sparse-shooting-S. I constructed a package of those functions to make them more convenient to use.
library(robcovsel)
library(shootings)
    gen = genevar(p = 10, e = 0.1)
x = gen$x
y = gen$y
    system.time({fit1 = covlasso(x,y,cor.method = "pair",scale.method = "qn")})  
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.051   0.006   0.058
system.time({fit2 = covlasso(x,y,cor.method = "gaussrank",scale.method = "qn")})
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.003   0.000   0.003
system.time({fit3 = sparseshooting(x,y)})
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   1.002   0.039   1.042

summary(lm(y~x))
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = y ~ x)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -10.3781  -2.7472  -0.0119   2.9597   8.0407 
#> 
#> Coefficients:

#> (Intercept) -0.636585   0.401733  -1.585 0.116605

lm(y~x)$coe[-1]
#>           x1           x2           x3           x4           x5           x6 
#>  0.255829311  0.486187377  0.481264391  0.005872061  0.222781201 -0.053194619 
#>           x7           x8           x9          x10 
#>  0.120072411  0.172738084 -0.329898909  0.086552272
cov(y)-t(cov(x,y))%*%MASS::ginv(cov(x))%*%cov(x,y)
#>          [,1]
#> [1,] 13.04312
tail(covlasso(x,y,cor.method = "pearson",scale.method = "sd", pda.method = F)$betahat,1)
